Package bankAccount

Class Extensions

java.lang.Object
bankAccount.Extensions
public class Extensions extends Object
Extensions Class
- Responsible for validating input and perfoming cryptographic constructions throughout the application
- Contains methods for validating each data type used in the application
- Contains method for generating a random account number
- Contains methods for encrypting and decrypting a given String
- Contains method for generating an AES key for encryption and decryption based on the user password
Author:
David Rosoff, James Dermezis

    static String
    Decrypt(String data, SecretKeySpec secretKey)
    Decryption Method
    This method assumes that the data provided is a string, however it can easily be modified to use generics if desired
    Initialize cipher for Decryption - Better choice is "AES/GCM/PKCS5Padding", however "AES/GCM/NoPadding" is used as per bug report
    (https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8229043)

  • Method Details

    • ValidateInput

      public static <T> boolean ValidateInput(T input, String regex)
      Validate a Given input - Takes an input and a regex query (both in string form) and attempts to find a match for the query within the input
      Parameters:
      input - The input you want to validate
      regex - The regex to use for validation
      Returns:
      true/false - Returns true if match was found and false in all other cases

    • GenAccountNumber

      public static String GenAccountNumber()
      Generate a Random Account Number https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20536566/creating-a-random-string-with-a- z-and-0-9-in-java
      Returns:
      saltStr Random Account Number

    • Encrypt

      public static String Encrypt(String data, SecretKeySpec secretKey) throws NoSuchPaddingException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, IllegalBlockSizeException, BadPaddingException, InvalidKeyException, InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Encryption method
      This method assumes that the data provided is a string, however it can easily be modified to use generics if desired
      Initialize cipher for Encryption - Better choice is "AES/GCM/PKCS5Padding", however "AES/GCM/NoPadding" is used as per bug report
      (https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8229043)
      Parameters:
      data - The data to encrypt
      secretKey - The key to use for encryption
      Returns:
      The encrypted data encoded in Base64
      Throws:
      NoSuchPaddingException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
      IllegalBlockSizeException
      BadPaddingException
      InvalidKeyException
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

    • Decrypt

      public static String Decrypt(String data, SecretKeySpec secretKey) throws NoSuchPaddingException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeyException, IllegalBlockSizeException, BadPaddingException, InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Decryption Method
      This method assumes that the data provided is a string, however it can easily be modified to use generics if desired
      Initialize cipher for Decryption - Better choice is "AES/GCM/PKCS5Padding", however "AES/GCM/NoPadding" is used as per bug report
      (https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8229043)
      Parameters:
      data - Encrypted data to decrypt
      secretKey - The key to be used for decryption
      Returns:
      The decrypted data
      Throws:
      NoSuchPaddingException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
      InvalidKeyException
      IllegalBlockSizeException
      BadPaddingException
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

    • setKey

      public static SecretKeySpec setKey(String password) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Key Generation Method
      Generates an Encryption key based on the provided password
      Parameters:
      password - the password to use
      Returns:
      The encryption key
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
